20101203074824.000|20101203074826.000|CCO|OTHER CROCODILES THAT HE SITS 
20101203074826.000|20101203074828.000|CCO|ALONE ATOP THE FOOD CHAIN.
20101203074828.000|20101203074830.000|CCO|DURING THE WET SEASON, WHEN 
20101203074830.000|20101203074832.000|CCO|ANIMALS ARRIVE IN DROVES, THESE 
20101203074832.000|20101203074834.000|CCO|WATERS BECOME A FEEDING GROUND 
20101203074834.000|20101203074836.000|CCO|FOR THE CROCODILE.
20101203074836.000|20101203074838.000|CCO|DINNER TODAY, DUCK.
20101203074838.000|20101203074840.000|CCO|HE SWALLOWS BY OPENING A VALVE 
20101203074840.000|20101203074842.000|CCO|IN HIS THROAT AND KEEPS HIS HEAD
20101203074842.000|20101203074844.500|CCO|HELD HIGH TO KEEP WATER FROM

20101203074920.750|20101203074922.000|CCO|PREY.
20101203074922.000|20101203074923.667|CCO|AND THEN THEY ROLL, THEY DO

20101203074936.000|20101203074938.000|CCO|>> Reporter: WHEN NOT FEEDING OR
